text:
3.4%ABV. Gose

Tapped out pale yellow. 2SRM.

Mouthfeel is soda and mineral water. Palate has sweet pale malt with white bread, fresh biscuits. Salty, mineral body with a faint fruity, citrus body.

Clean finish.

Dry. Tart. Lightly fruity. Pale yellow with a bright white head that leaves a clean glass. Light bodied. Crisp. Refreshing. Light tartness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg @ Cigar City. Pale straw color with a small head. Nose has some nice wheat character. A bit of puss. Salted lemon. Herb. Flavor is delicately tart. Light citrus. Mineral. Dry finish. Soft body, mellow carb. Crushable

Draught at the brewery on February 7, 2017.Listed as 3.4% ABV.Hazy pale straw yellow color, Malty, spicy, slight acidic scent. Acidic, lemon taste. Acidic aftertaste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, very low bitterness.

Crowler with thanks to Homer! Pours lightly hazy pale golden, large creamy white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is dusty and salty, wheat sour mash, hints of lime and lacto. Flavor is light tart, sour mash, medium salty, citrus hints. Light plus body, creamy mouthfeel. Pretty damn good.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow on tap with bubbly white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of nice lactic acidity, earth, and wheat. Taste is more toward an acidic citrus, nice earthy salt note, and mild malt. Really well done American version of the style.

Growler at RBWG Grand Tasting. Pours a clear yellow gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong sea salt, lime zest, wheat. Thin body, salt, lime, dough, crisp and crushable, very nice.

Poured a golden color with aromas of light dough, sour wheat, cereal, and lit saltiness. Flavors match the aromas not over the top sour and salty, just enough that the palate demanded more. I could drink this beer all day.

2/21/15. Growler or crowler during RBWG 2015. Golden orange pour with a nice off-white head, good lacing. Mild aroma, light lemon peel and lactic sourness, mild earthy salt aspect. Lightly tart flavor, doughy wheat, mild salt. Pretty good considering the super low ABV.

Growler shared at RBWG 15 Grand Tasting @ Coppertail, thanks to whomever shared this one, 21/02/15.
Hazed orange yellow with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is pissy citric peel, straw, lemon rind, woody.
Taste comprises light yeast, lemon peel, light funk, vanilla, wood must, damp grass, salt lick light, dried crackers.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid affair for the ABV with plenty of depth and mild soured fruit.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler at RBWG. Very nice gose. Salty, lemon, crisp, grainy, slightly tart. Extremely drinkable.
Growler at Coppertail Brewing during the RBWG 2015 Grand Tasting. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of salt, lemons. Tastes of lemon citrus, salt, floral. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Draft. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of sea salt, sour lemon, sour banana, lactose. Medium body.
Growler - Nice light salty corn notes. Cloudy yellow with a decent white head. Light grain and corn with some nice salty notes. Well done.

Draft... This beer rocks! Pours hazy and pear-colored with a small, wispy, white. Decent retention. The aroma is both citric and grainy. Light to medium-bodied with stinging carbonation. The flavor is super tart with some graininess and a pinch of salt. Finishes crisp, tart and totally clean. As with nearly all goses (except Gravity Brewlabs) this could use more salt. No such thing as too much salt. Otherwise, totally delicious and crushable. Im with Dak; this needs to be canned or bottled and distributed. World class beer right here!

32 oz. Crowler from Homer321. First of all, LOVE these Crowlers! Hopefully they catch on. This one pours a hazy pale yellow with a tall but disappearing fizzy white head. The aroma is spot on with nice salty lemons, hints of lacto and fresh bread. Smells like summer. The flavor is equally good with salty/tartness up front followed by a bready malt base and a salty, biscuity aftertaste. The body is perfectly light and lively. A delicious beer no doubt.
Straw colored pour, white head. Nice and sour, salty, funky. This is pretty damn good. I could drink gallons. Cans please?

From the tailgate. Smell is sharply tart and sour with a light pungent aroma. Pour is pale gold with a light tiny and a large white head that dies quickly. Taste is quenching, lightly salty, refreshing, and dangerously drinkable. Man I wish there were cans so I could get more. Thanks
Growler courtesy of Lynn (thanks!). Light peachy pour. Aroma is fruity, salt, hay, grain. Tastes are cereal, light even tart, grapefruit. Pretty straightforward, but pleasant. Good beach beer. 7.6

32oz pour into my CCB Oktoberfest Stein. Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of sour wheat, coriander, and lemon. Taste is tart, sour wheat, coriander, salt with a bready wheat finish. This is light and refreshing yet really flavorful. I could drink this all day and I just might until it runs out!
